greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the largest part of the k-th partition of n, with partitions in colexicographic order.
comment: Row n lists the first A000041(n) terms of A141285.

The representation of the partitions (for fixed n) is as (weakly) decreasing lists of parts, the order between individual partitions (for the same n) is co-lexicographic, see example. - _Joerg Arndt_, Sep 13 2013
example: For n = 5 the partitions of 5 in colexicographic order are:
so the fifth row is the largest in each partition: 1,2,3,2,4,3,5
xref: The sum of row n is A006128(n).
Let y be the n-th integer partition in colexicographic order (A211992):
- The maximum of y is a(n).
- The length of y is A193173(n).
- The minimum of y is A196931(n).
- The Heinz number of y is A334437(n).
Lexicographically ordered reversed partitions are A026791.
Reversed partitions in Abramowitz-Stegun order (sum/length/lex) are A036036.
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Dec 10 2011
